intro: Chrysanthemum yamazutanum, commonly known as the Japanese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Chrysanthemum yamazutanum is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes and has cultural significance in Japan and other parts of Asia.
